intro: Turnera sidoides var. angustiloba, commonly known as narrow-leaf turnera, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in the spring or early summer. The species is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
